conclusion: Analyze the motion of both the motorcycle and the car using their respective velocity-time graphs.
The velocity-time graph of the motorcycle shows a linear decrease from 4 m/s to 0 m/s over 8 s.
Derive the equation of motion for the motorcycle: v(t) = 4 - 0.5t.
Calculate the distance traveled by the motorcycle: d_motorcycle = 16 m.
The velocity of the car is given by v_2 = 3 - 0.25t.
Calculate the distance traveled by the car: d_car = 16 m.
Calculate the relative distance between the two vehicles when they stop: Î”d = 0 m.
Determine the minimum safe distance to prevent a collision: 1.5 m.
